New Records: Olivier Giroud scored his 57th international goal, extending his record as France's all-time leading marksman.
Key Match Events: France recovered from an early goal by Marcelino Nunez to win 3-2.
Youssouf Fofana scored the equalizer for France with a deflected shot.
Randal Kolo Muani headed in a cross by Theo Hernández to put France ahead.
Olivier Giroud scored the third goal for France after a setup by Kolo Muani.
Dario Osorio scored a late goal for Chile.
Pre-Game Insights: France made nine changes to their starting lineup, with Kylian Mbappe and Aurélien Tchouameni being the only retained players.
Chile was playing their second game under new Argentinian coach Ricardo Gareca.
Post-Match Reflections: The result eased doubts surrounding the French team after their loss to Germany.
The match served as preparation for France ahead of the European Championship in June and July.
Chile is building up to the Copa America in the USA in June.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jonathan Clauss and Eduardo Camavinga were forced off injured in the first half.
France appeared at risk of losing consecutive games for the first time since June 2015.
